description: Featuring lectures by Penn faculty and visiting scholars, this course will cover the period from the Indus Valley culture to the beginnings of British India. It will focus on interacting powers of creativity, production, and control at work in the cultures, economies, and politics of South Asia. We pay particular attention to the changing character of regions within the subcontinent and its surrounding world.
name: ASIAN CONTACTS W/ WORLD: Asian Contacts with the World
